Package se.arkalix.net.http.service

Class HttpValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.arkalix.net.http.service.HttpValidator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HttpRoutable
    public class HttpValidator
extends java.lang.Object
implements HttpRoutable
    A HttpServiceInternal validator, useful for verifying and/or responding to incoming HTTP requests before they are provided to their designated HttpRoutes.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      HttpValidator​(int ordinal, HttpMethod method, HttpPattern pattern, HttpValidatorHandler handler)
      Creates new HttpServiceInternal filter.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HttpValidator

        public HttpValidator​(int ordinal,
                     HttpMethod method,
                     HttpPattern pattern,
                     HttpValidatorHandler handler)
        Creates new HttpServiceInternal filter.
        Parameters:
        ordinal - When to execute the filter relative to other filters. Lower numbers are executed first.
        method - HTTP method to require in filtered requests. Use null to allow any method.
        pattern - HTTP pattern to require filtered request paths to match. Use null to allow any path.
        handler - The handler to execute with matching requests.

    • Method Detail

      • ordinal

        public int ordinal()
        Returns:
        Integer indicating when to execute this validator in relation to other catchers that match the same methods and have the exact same patterns.

      • method

        public java.util.Optional<HttpMethod> method()
        Specified by:
        method in interface HttpRoutable
        Returns:
        HttpMethod, if any, that requests causing thrown exceptions must match for this validator to be invoked.

      • pattern

        public java.util.Optional<HttpPattern> pattern()
        Specified by:
        pattern in interface HttpRoutable
        Returns:
        HttpPattern, if any, that paths of requests causing thrown exceptions must match for this validator to be invoked.

      • tryHandle

        public Future<java.lang.Boolean> tryHandle​(HttpRouteTask task)
        Offers this validator the opportunity to respond to the request in the given task. If it does respond, it is assumed that the request needs no more processing and a response is sent to the requester immediately.

        A validator will typically only handle a request if it is invalid.

        Parameters:
        task - Incoming HTTP request route task.
        Returns:
        Future completed when validation is complete. Its value is true only if the request was handled.
